Runes\"∠∠∠In the beginning, there∠was Darkness, and∠Darkness lived for eons∠in a rift in time."},{"id":945,"text":"Eventually, having∠suffered in solitude∠for so long, Darkness∠shed a Tear. ∠∠From this Tear were born∠two brothers:∠∠Sword and Shield."},{"id":946,"text":"∠∠Sword bragged that he∠could cut anything to∠pieces, and to that∠Shield answered that∠nothing could ever∠harm him.∠∠And so, the two fought."},{"id":947,"text":"∠∠Their battle raged for∠seven days and seven∠nights.∠∠Sword tore apart Shield.∠∠Shield shattered Sword."},{"id":948,"text":"The fragments of Sword∠rained down and formed∠the sky.∠The fragments of Shield∠rained down and formed∠the earth.∠∠The sparks from their∠battle became the stars."},{"id":949,"text":"∠And the 27 jewels that∠adorned Sword and Shield∠were turned into∠the 27 True Runes, ∠and so the world began."},{"id":950,"text":"\"Ancient Teachings\""},{"id":951,"text":"Runes can sometimes∠give men great power,∠the greatest of all∠being magic.∠∠Each rune contains four∠magical powers, and∠grants its bearer the∠use of four spells. Such∠is the law of the runes."},{"id":952,"text":"But in ancient times,∠the great magician∠Crowley found a way to∠surpass this law and use∠even more powerful magic.∠∠Unite two souls, unite∠two runes, and release∠their most potent power.∠This will grant you even∠greater magic."},{"id":953,"text":"∠∠∠To \"unite two souls\"∠simply means that two∠magic users must cast∠spells at the same time."},{"id":954,"text":"To \"unite two runes\"∠means pairing a rune∠with its complement:∠∠Fire with Earth,∠Earth with Wind,∠Wind with Water,∠Water with Lightning,∠and Lightning with Fire."},{"id":955,"text":"And \"their most potent∠power\" means using the∠runes' strongest spells.∠∠When these conditions∠are met, immensely∠powerful runic magic∠will be unleashed."},{"id":956,"text":"\"The Art of War\"∠∠Success in battle begins∠with understanding the∠moves your opponent∠will make.∠∠Soldiers best arrows,∠arrows best magic, and∠magic bests soldiers."},{"id":957,"text":"Thus, he who knows his∠opponent's next move∠will naturally gain the∠upper hand.∠∠In order to do this,∠the use of ninja is∠essential. Therefore,∠one should enlist∠as many ninja allies∠as possible."},{"id":958,"text":"Enemy movements follow∠a set number of patterns,∠and understanding them∠is a shortcut to victory.∠∠If your opponent's forces∠contain no magic users,∠choose charge attacks."},{"id":959,"text":"Betrayal is most∠effective when your own∠numbers are low and∠enemy numbers are high.∠∠When the enemy has∠been reduced to a few,∠turn to bow attacks."},{"id":960,"text":"When your forces are∠great, use soldiers and∠arrows. When you are∠few in number, magic∠is effective.∠∠The only way to increase∠your forces is to seek∠and recruit allies."},{"id":961,"text":"∠∠∠∠Aside from that, all that∠remains is training…"},{"id":962,"text":"∠\"The Dragon Knights\"∠∠The order of the Dragon∠Knights is led by Joshua∠Levenheit, who is∠renowned as the bearer∠of the Dragon Rune."},{"id":963,"text":"Under his command are∠36 Dragon Knights,∠17 esquires, and∠6 pages.∠∠∠The children of the∠Dragon Knights are∠raised in the fortress∠from a tender age."},{"id":964,"text":"Once each year, they∠partake in the Hatching∠Ceremony, and those who∠are able to form a bond∠with a dragon are∠permitted to become∠Dragon Knights."},{"id":965,"text":"If a child is unable to∠form a bond with a∠dragon by the age of∠six, that child shall∠never become a∠Dragon Knight."},{"id":966,"text":"The bond between a∠dragon and its master∠is very strong. Dragons∠have far longer∠lifespans than humans,∠but when a Dragon Knight∠dies, his or her dragon∠will take its own life∠out of sheer sorrow."},{"id":967,"text":"Conversely, if the∠dragon should die first,∠no matter the reason,∠its master loses his or∠her status as a Dragon∠Knight and must leave∠the knighthood."},{"id":968,"text":"\"Craftsman Chronicles\"∠- Mace∠Master blacksmith.∠A stubborn man, but he∠will do anything for his∠apprentices.∠∠-Tesla∠Scrivener residing in∠Antei. Highly skilled."},{"id":969,"text":"- Gen∠Diligent and strong-∠willed shipwright. He∠works in Teien.∠∠- Templeton∠Cartographer. Whenever a∠change occurs somewhere∠he is certain to appear∠there in order to ensure∠the accuracy of his maps."},{"id":970,"text":"- Kimberly∠Ostensibly a stamp-∠maker, but behind the∠scenes...∠∠- Sergei∠Struggling inventor.∠Said to currently be in∠the town of Kaku."},{"id":971,"text":"- Antonio∠Lives hidden away in the∠village of Seika, but is∠a talented cook.∠∠- Lester∠Cook who specializes in∠stews. Said to currently∠be in the town of Kirov."},{"id":972,"text":"- Hugo∠Works as a librarian at∠Qlon Temple.∠∠∠- Kasios∠Wandering minstrel.∠Enamored with Milich,∠he now sings as his∠personal bard."},{"id":973,"text":"- Jabba∠Sharp-eyed appraiser.∠A proud man, he claims∠that there is nothing∠he cannot appraise.∠∠- Kamandol∠Renowned alchemist∠from the town of Teien."},{"id":974,"text":"\"Imperial Guard∠　　Black List\"∠∠The following list,∠compiled by the Imperial∠Guard, describes∠potentially dangerous∠individuals who may∠harbor ill intentions∠towards the Empire."},{"id":975,"text":"- Clive∠Seemingly on the trail of∠someone with the intent∠of exacting revenge.∠He owns a weapon known∠as a \"gun\" that is able∠to shoot fire. Reports∠indicate that he is∠occasionally sighted at∠a tavern in the town of∠Premier L'Amour (Rikon)."},{"id":976,"text":"- Kreutz∠Served under former∠emperor Geil Rugner. His∠location was unknown∠for a long time, but it is∠now clear that he is being∠harbored by the Dragon∠Knights. He has crossed∠swords with Humphrey∠Mintz of the Liberation∠Army numerous times."},{"id":977,"text":"- Anji∠A pirate operating∠around Lake Toran. The reason∠for this is unknown."},{"id":989,"text":"Imperial Army strategist∠Leon Silverberg∠did not hide this∠terrible incident from∠the Empire's troops.∠∠Despite their exhaustion∠after the long march∠north, they were deeply∠enraged by the news."},{"id":990,"text":"With renewed vigor,∠they succeeded in∠driving back the∠City-States' forces."},{"id":991,"text":"Hirotaka's∠Dev Diary∠(Library)∠∠The Game Master∠used a request card.∠∠∠My days of helping out∠began."},{"id":992,"text":"Monday, July 7th∠Background graphics∠completed.∠∠Tuesday, July 11th∠Page graphics∠completed.∠∠Wednesday, July 12th∠Inserted text."},{"id":993,"text":"(Mural)∠The Game Master∠brought me my next job.∠∠∠Thursday, July 13th∠Piece graphics∠completed.∠∠Not much time, so∠finished in one day."},{"id":994,"text":"(Stone Monument)∠Monday, July 17th -∠Friday, July 21st∠Didn't know the faces,∠so it was hard work.∠∠(Bath)∠Monday, July 24th -∠Saturday, July 29th∠I want a bath, too!"},{"id":995,"text":"This game is…∠∠(The rest is worn out∠and unreadable.)"},{"id":996,"text":"Sound Mode"},{"id":997,"text":"Listen to music from the games."},{"id":998,"text":"Cinematics"},{"id":999,"text":"Watch the cinematic cutscenes from the games."},{"id":1000,"text":"Event Viewer"},{"id":1001,"text":"Relive the events that play out through the game's story."},{"id":1002,"text":"Endings"},{"id":1003,"text":"Rewatch the endings again."},{"id":1004,"text":"Credits"},{"id":1005,"text":"View the credits."},{"id":1006,"text":"Visuals"},{"id":1007,"text":"The Remastered characters are layered with a new effect on their pixel art.
